0.04.text: Hello and welcome back to English with Lucy

2.98.text: I've got a pronunciation video for you today

6.08.text: and it's all about 10 words that you might be pronouncing incorrectly

13.42.text: Ok so the first word is this one!

23.28.text: There are not two syllables there

30.40.text: So many students make the mistake of saying 'fru-it'

38.78.text: And fruit is my favourite food

41.26.text: The next word we have is this one

46.00.text: So many students actually pronounce this how they would pronounce it in their own language

51.46.text: Probably the Italians and the Spanish more than anything

54.70.text: But we pronounce this not cha-os

66.24.text: The same with the adjective form.. it was 'chaotic'.

74.68.text: Now I remember learning to spell this word when I was at school

78.76.text: and thinking 'wow, that's a crazy spelling'

82.12.text: because it's so different to the pronunciation

84.74.text: Now I've heard all different pronunciations for this word

88.66.text: I've heard kuwew, I've head kyooyoo

94.80.text: one syllable, and everyone knows that British people

98.40.text: love queueing, queue, to queue, there is a queue

102.24.text: there's the verb and the noun aswell

104.42.text: Now on to number four and this one always makes me laugh when people say this

107.88.text: cos it is really difficult to say. It is...

114.82.text: I used to work in a cafe with a lot of foreign workers

118.18.text: and they would always say 'Where are the crips?'

119.82.text: and I'd be like 'crips? are you talking about crepes?'

124.58.text: This 'sps' sound is very difficult for some people to say so you need to practice this in the mirror before you brush your teeth every night...crisps

133.62.text: Ok number five is this one

137.18.text: If you like cooking then you should have seen this word before

140.84.text: And most people say resips or reseeps

148.16.text: So it's very irregular this word

150.34.text: normally when an e is on the end we don't pronounce it

153.78.text: but in this case we do

162.64.text: Ok so many people pronounce this incorrectly

165.98.text: they want to say every syllable

173.38.text: comfortable, so it's not com-for-ta-ble, it's just comf-t-ble

179.20.text: ok so we actually lose a syllable there

182.60.text: the same goes for number seven which is

197.58.text: very important word, if you don't know this word then you're crazy

201.30.text: cos it's a big part of my life

212.00.text: So it's just 2 syllables and I understand it's quite hard for many people to pronouce

217.30.text: but, you wanna speak English well you got to practice

223.74.text: Ok and my last two are days of the week

229.30.text: not one of my favourite days of the week but it's very important to pronounce it correctly

241.92.text: choose, like I want to choose what I'm having for breakfast this morning

262.88.text: So that's it for this pronunciation lesson

265.18.text: I really hope it helped you

267.54.text: and hopefully you can now pronounce these words more confidently

271.36.text: You will need to repeat and practice again and again and again

274.66.text: but that's part of learning a language so get started now!

278.12.text: make sure that you connect with me on all of my social media

282.98.text: and I look forward to seeing you in class very very soon! mwah!
